rooms.description: This open space welcomes visitors and directs traffic into the living areas. It incorporates ample natural light from floor-to-ceiling windows along one wall, aligning with Vastu principles for welcoming energy.
Spacious and airy with floor-to-ceiling windows providing abundant daylight. The design integrates a blend of colonial aesthetics with modern touches suitable for a joint family setting.

A formal dining area adjacent to the living room, designed with ample space for communal meals and gatherings. Windows on the south-east side enhance natural light in accordance with Vastu guidelines.
Modern colonial kitchen with floor-to-ceiling windows ensuring a bright workspace. The layout is designed for efficiency and ease of movement, keeping the east-west circulation in mind.
A serene bedroom space with ample natural light from floor-to-ceiling windows, positioned favorably based on Vastu for calm and restful sleep.
Convenient guest room designed for comfort. Features floor-to-ceiling windows to ensure a bright atmosphere while maintaining privacy.
Additional bedroom allocated for joint family members, with natural lighting and colonial detailing.
A multi-purpose room serving as a quiet retreat or study area, fitted with floor-to-ceiling windows that facilitate both privacy and openness. Designed to blend seamlessly into the living area.
Dedicated library space for reading and research, designed with cozy lighting and ample shelving. The west-facing window adds a pleasant ambience without disrupting Vastu flow.
A dedicated gym area for fitness activities, ensuring privacy and ample space for equipment. It incorporates large windows that allow natural light while maintaining an energetic ambiance.
Space allocated for storage, laundry, and service areas to support the household functions of a joint family.

openings.description: The main entrance door placed to welcome positive energy in accordance with Vastu principles.
Floor-to-ceiling windows installed throughout the residence for natural lighting and ventilation.

levels.notes: The design integrates colonial elements with modern functionality. Vastu principles are adhered to by positioning major rooms in the north, east, and south directions, while the west is reserved for secondary spaces such as the library and private gym.
